headline: Russia to relax labour laws allowing minors to do ‘dangerous’ jobs amid manpower shortage

script.veo3_visual_prompt: A cramped, dimly lit, dusty mine shaft interior. DMITRI (10, small for his age, wearing an oversized, ill-fitting hard hat and safety goggles), is awkwardly chiseling at a rock face with a small, child-sized pickaxe, struggling to hold it. Sweat streaks his grime-covered face. MARIA (30s, sharp business suit, wide eyes), stands awkwardly nearby, looking visibly concerned. SVETLANA (50s, stern face, crisp uniform, holding a clipboard), observes Dmitri with a critical but unperturbed expression. CAMERA: Medium shot, static, capturing the tight space and Maria's growing unease. STYLE: Gritty, industrial lighting with practical work lamps. 9:16 vertical portrait aspect ratio.
script.dialogue: Svetlana: (matter-of-fact) "Dmitri, higher up. Small hands, precise work." Maria: (quietly, to herself) "Precise..."
script.audio_cues: Distant clanking, dripping water, faint scraping of pickaxe, Dmitri's strained grunts.

script.veo3_visual_prompt: A perilous, incomplete metal scaffolding high above a sprawling construction site. Wind whips past. ANNA (8, slight build, wearing an ill-fitting safety harness that's too big and a tiny, bright yellow helmet) is perched precariously on a swaying plank, attempting to tighten a massive industrial bolt with a wrench twice her size. Below, BORIS (40s, burly, grizzled foreman, sipping tea from a thermos, utterly calm) gestures upwards, completely unfazed. Maria watches, aghast, hand covering her mouth, eyes wide with quiet horror. CAMERA: Low-angle tracking shot, following Anna's precarious movements on the scaffolding, then pushing in slowly on Maria's horrified face. STYLE: Harsh, windy daylight, extreme sense of vertigo and height. 9:16 vertical portrait aspect ratio.
script.dialogue: Boris: (calling up, calm, unconcerned) "Anna! Quarter turn! We need that pipe secure by lunch!" Anna: (straining, tiny voice) "It's stuck, Uncle Boris!" Maria: (whispering, horrified, to herself) "Uncle... Boris?"
script.audio_cues: Gusting wind, creaking metal, distant city construction noises, faint metallic clang.

script.veo3_visual_prompt: A sterile, brightly lit nuclear waste processing facility interior, full of blinking lights, humming machinery, and containment warnings. In the center, a gigantic, bubbling vat of glowing green liquid. OLGA (6, tiny, completely dwarfed by an oversized, bulky HAZMAT suit with a clear bubble helmet) stands on a small, yellow stepladder, earnestly stirring the glowing sludge with a comically long, wooden spoon. The spoon handle is held with both tiny, gloved hands. Svetlana and Boris stand side-by-side, proudly watching Olga. Maria is slumped against a clean white wall, eyes wide and unfocused, completely broken, a deadpan stare fixed on nothing. A "Safety First" poster is ironically visible on the wall behind them. CAMERA: Dolly-in from a medium shot to a close-up on Olga's bewildered face inside the helmet, then a slow push-in on Maria's utterly defeated, deadpan expression. STYLE: Overly clean, almost clinical, contrasting starkly with the absurdly dangerous task. 9:16 vertical portrait aspect ratio.
script.dialogue: Svetlana: (nodding approvingly, prideful) "See? Smallest aperture, minimum exposure. Genius!" Boris: (grunting proudly, arms crossed) "Perfect for the isotope stabilization. Very light on her feet." Maria: (flat, defeated whisper) "Her... feet..." Olga: (muffled, through helmet, innocently) "Mommy, can I have a snack now?"
script.audio_cues: Constant low hum of machinery, gentle bubbling of the vat, faint whirring, Olga's muffled voice.
